resources.description: These are the tools for development and coding. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Visual Studio Code
items.description: The best text editor in the world. See next resource for my current setup.

items.name: My Visual Studio Code Setup
items.description: Check out exactly what theme, extensions and settings I currently use in VSCode.

items.name: Codepen
items.description: Codepen is an essential tool to quickly test out ideas. I use it in multiple courses too.

items.name: Emmet Cheat Sheet
items.description: Emmet is an essential tool for writing HTML. I teach it in my advanced CSS course. This is a very handy cheat sheet to get started.

resources.description: These are the tools I use to design websites and apps. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Figma
items.description: The best design tool in the world. I use it to design all my websites and apps.

items.name: Sketch
items.description: Another very popular design tool, but only available for Mac. I don't use it, but many people love it.

items.name: Adobe XD
items.description: Adobe's design tool. I don't use it, but many people love it.

items.name: Canva
items.description: A very popular design tool for non-designers. I don't use it, but many people love it.

resources.description: These are the best resources for HTML5. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Jonas' HTML5 and CSS3 Course
items.description: My premium course for building beautiful responsive websites with HTML and CSS.

items.name: HTML5 Reference by MDN
items.description: You don't need to know every HTML element. I just use this excellent reference all the time.

items.name: HTML Entity Reference by CSS-Tricks
items.description: Super useful reference, gives you HTML entity name, numeric code, hex code and ISO code.

items.name: W3Schools HTML Reference
items.description: Another HTML reference, this one is from W3Schools. I don't use it, but many people love it.

resources.description: These are the best resources for CSS. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Jonas' Advanced CSS Course
items.description: Master advanced and modern CSS, responsive design, Sass, flexbox, CSS Grid, and so much more!

items.name: CSS3 Reference by MDN
items.description: As with HTML, you don't need to know every CSS property. Use this reference instead.

items.name: CSS3 Reference by Codrops
items.description: Another excellent CSS reference, this time from Codrops. Make sure to check this one out, too.

items.name: Can I Use?
items.description: Up-to-date browser support tables for front-end technologies on desktop and mobile browsers.

items.name: 30 CSS Selectors by Tutplus
items.description: I find myself using this handy list of the 30 most important CSS selectors from Tutplus all the time.

items.name: CSS for People Who Hate CSS
items.description: Excellent guide on how to write better, cleaner and more reusable CSS code.

items.name: Clippy
items.description: A small tool to help you using the new and powerful clip-path property.

items.name: CSS easing functions
items.description: An amazing collection of easing functions to be used in CSS transitions and animations.

resources.description: These are the best resources for JavaScript. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Jonas' JavaScript Course
items.description: My premium course to learn and truly understand JavaScript, by coding real-world projects.

items.name: JavaScript Reference by MDN
items.description: Another reference by MDN, this one is for JavaScript. This is pretty advanced stuff.

items.name: JavaScript Operator Precedence Table
items.description: Very handy cheatsheet to determine which JavaScript operators are evaluated first.

items.name: JavaScript Event Reference
items.description: Handy reference list of all DOM events with explanations, nicely categorized.

items.name: ES6+ Browser Compatibility Table
items.description: Check out all the new ES6+ features supported and their browser support.

items.name: DOM Manipulation Reference
items.description: Called 'You Might Not Need jQuery', but I use this as a complete DOM manipulation reference.

items.name: JavaScript KeyCodes Reference
items.description: Get keyboard codes, unicodes and keycodes. Vital reference for keypress event handling.

items.name: Principles of Writing Good JavaScript
items.description: While I don't follow this 100%, it's good to have a style guide to write better code.

items.name: JavaScript Design Patterns
items.description: For more advanced developers: learn all common JavaScript design patterns. Perfect reference.

resources.description: These are the best CSS frameworks. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Bootstrap
items.description: The most popular CSS framework in the world. I use it in my Bootstrap course.

items.name: Tailwind CSS
items.description: A utility-first CSS framework for creating custom designs without having to leave your HTML.

items.name: Bulma
items.description: A modern CSS framework based on Flexbox. I don't use it, but many people love it.

items.name: Foundation
items.description: Another very popular CSS framework. I don't use it, but many people love it.

items.name: SASS
items.description: A CSS preprocessor that adds power and elegance to the basic language. It is also the most popular CSS preprocessor.

resources.description: These are the best React.js and Next.js resources. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: React.js
items.description: The most popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces. I use it in my React course.

items.name: Next.js
items.description: A React framework for building server-side rendered applications. I use it in my Next.js course.

items.name: React Router
items.description: Declarative routing for React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: Redux
items.description: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React Query
items.description: A powerful data-fetching library for React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React Testing Library
items.description: A simple and complete testing utility for React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React DevTools
items.description: A Chrome and Firefox DevTools extension for debugging React.js applications.

items.name: React Hook Form
items.description: A performant, flexible and extensible forms library for React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React Icons
items.description: A collection of popular icons for React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: Styled Components
items.description: A library for writing CSS in JavaScript. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React Spring
items.description: A library for creating animations in React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React Router Dom
items.description: A collection of navigational components for React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: React Helmet
items.description: A library for managing changes to the document head in React.js. I use it in my React course.

items.name: shadcn/ui
items.description: A collection of components and hooks for building beautiful user interfaces in React.js.

resources.description: These are the best resources for fonts and typography. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Google Fonts
items.description: The #1 resource for free and easy-to-use webfonts. Has a huge library of fonts.

items.name: Fontsquirrel
items.description: The best, 100% free fonts for commercial use. Another well-known huge font library.

items.name: The 100 best free fonts by Creative Bloq
items.description: List of free fonts, from vintage-inspired typefaces to slab serifs, for a range of projects.

items.name: MyFonts
items.description: World's largest library of premium fonts, if you need more than free fonts for your next project.

items.name: A Pocket Guide to Typography
items.description: Amazing resource to learn about typography. Learn typography basics in less than 30 minutes.

items.name: Type Scale
items.description: A tool to help you choose the right font size for your website. It also has a great typography scale generator.

items.name: What The Font
items.description: Upload an image and this tool will tell you which font is used in that image.

items.name: What The Font
items.description: Upload an image and this tool will tell you which font is used in that image.

resources.description: These are the best resources for colors and color palettes. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Open Color
items.description: An open-source color scheme, optimized for UI. My go-to resource to choose colors from scratch.

items.name: Tailwind Colors
items.description: Another excellent and popular set of color palettes. Great selection of colors for all your projects.

items.name: Flat UI Colors
items.description: A good starting point for choosing a flat design color for your next project.

items.name: Material Palette
items.description: Yet another set of colors, inspired in material design. Generate and download your palette.

items.name: Colorhunt Palettes
items.description: Don't know what colors to use for your website? Colorhunt helps you with beautiful color palettes.

items.name: LOL Colors Palettes
items.description: Curated color palettes inspiration. Another source for great color palettes.

items.name: UI Gradients
items.description: Collection of beautiful color gradients for you to choose from and export to your project.

items.name: Paletton
items.description: A very popular tool which allows you to create color combinations that play well together.

items.name: Tint and Shade Generator
items.description: Easily create lighter and darker versions of any base color. Perfect for hovers, borders and gradients.

items.name: 0to255
items.description: Another helpful tool that generates variations of colors.

items.name: Coolors Contrast Checker
items.description: Tool to check whether two colors have a good contrast ratio. Essential for building accessible websites!

resources.description: These are the best resources for images and videos. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Unsplash
items.description: My #1 resource for free high-resolution photos. There are more photos here than you can imagine!

items.name: Pexels
items.description: Another great resource for free stock photos and videos, created by photographers around the world.

items.name: ISO Republic
items.description: Free and premium stock photos for your website. Easily searchable by topic.

items.name: Pixabay
items.description: Over 2M free stock photos, vectors and art illustrations you can use anywhere.

items.name: unDraw
items.description: Hundreds of free and open-source illustrations for your websites, and colors are even customizable.

items.name: DrawKit
items.description: Hand-drawn vector illustration and icon resources, perfect for your next project.

items.name: UI Faces
items.description: Avatar photos, perfect for mockups or placeholders. Don't use them for real people...

items.name: Random User Generator
items.description: Generate random user data, including photos. Like Lorem Ipsum, but for people.

items.name: Coverr
items.description: Best resource for beautiful and free videos about every imaginable topic, easily searchable.

items.name: Videvo
items.description: Another great resource for free stock videos and motion graphics.

resources.description: These are the best resources for icons. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Ionicons
items.description: A beautiful and round icon set, very easy to use, and 100% free even for commercial usage.

items.name: Hero Icons
items.description: A 230-pieces icon set, available in outline and solid styles, best used at 24x24 px.

items.name: Phosphor Icons
items.description: Another beautiful, more boxy SVG icon set. Customizable thickness and color.

items.name: Font Awesome
items.description: A highly popular icon font, consisting of 1000+ icons spread across countless categories.

items.name: Line Awesome
items.description: Font awesome (previous icons) looks a bit outdated at this point, so this is a very simple alternative.

items.name: Iconmonstr
items.description: 4500+ free and simple icons in 300+ collections, perfect if you need a single icon and not a whole set.

items.name: Icons8
items.description: An incredible premium resource. Has 175,000+ icons, some for free, across countless styles and categories.

items.name: Icon 54
items.description: 5000 vector icons for iOS, Android, Websites and Apps. Worth checking out if you have a budget!

items.name: Icomoon
items.description: Tool to convert icon fonts to SVG icons and sprites. I use it in my advanced CSS course.

items.name: Iconjar
items.description: A macOS app to organize, search and use all your icons in an easy way.

items.name: Noun Project
items.description: A huge library of icons, available in multiple styles. Some are free, but most are paid.

items.name: Flaticon
items.description: Another huge library of icons, available in multiple styles. Some are free, but most are paid.

items.name: React icons
items.description: A collection of popular icons for React. I use it in my React course.

items.name: Fontello
items.description: Another tool to convert icon fonts to SVG icons and sprites. I use it in my advanced CSS course.

resources.description: These are the best resources to find design inspiration. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Land Book
items.description: Showcase of beautiful web design. My essential #1 inspiration resource when I design websites!

items.name: One Page Love
items.description: Another gallery of beautiful websites, sorted into multiple categories.

items.name: Awwwards
items.description: The awards of design, creativity and innovation on the internet. This one features more creative designs.

items.name: Screelane
items.description: Inspiration for individual elements and components. Another of my go-to resources!

items.name: Dribbble
items.description: Most well-known destination to find design inspiration, not just web design.

items.name: Behance
items.description: Another well-known destination to find design inspiration, not just web design.

items.name: Pinterest
items.description: A social media platform to find and share design inspiration. I use it all the time.

resources.description: These are the best blogs and communities for web developers. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Stack Overflow
items.description: The biggest programmer community. Ask and find answers to HTML, CSS and JS questions.

items.name: CSS Tricks
items.description: Excellent articles, guides, and even an almanac, all about front-end development, with a focus on CSS.

items.name: Smashing Magazine
items.description: A very popular web dev blog, writing about all things coding and designing.

items.name: Codrops
items.description: Another blog, featuring articles and tutorials about latest web trends and techniques.

items.name: Hey Designer
items.description: Curated articles for designers and front-end developers. Available as a newsletter.

items.name: Front End Front
items.description: A place where front-end developers can ask questions, share links, and show their work.

items.name: Frontend Focus
items.description: A weekly newsletter with the latest news and articles about front-end development.

items.name: CSS Weekly
items.description: A weekly newsletter with the latest news and articles about CSS.

items.name: JavaScript Weekly
items.description: A weekly newsletter with the latest news and articles about JavaScript.

items.name: Frontend Masters
items.description: A premium platform with the best courses about front-end development. I use it all the time.

items.name: CSS Zen Garden
items.description: A website that showcases the beauty of CSS. A great source of inspiration for your next project.

items.name: Web Designer News
items.description: A community of web designers and developers sharing the latest news and articles.

items.name: CSS Tricks Almanac
items.description: A complete guide to CSS properties, selectors, functions, and more.

resources.description: These are the best resources for testing, optimization and deployment. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: HTML Validator by W3C
items.description: Check if your HTML markup is valid and contains no errors. Official W3C tool.

items.name: CSS Validator by W3C
items.description: Check if your CSS code is valid and contains no errors. Official W3C tool.

items.name: Google PageSpeed Insights
items.description: Easy tool to test your webpage for performance. You can also use it in Chrome DevTools (Lighthouse).

items.name: Squoosh
items.description: Compressing images is the most important performance optimization. This is my #1 tool to do so!

items.name: Optimizilla
items.description: Another tool to compress up to 20 JPEG and PNG images while keeping a good level of quality.

items.name: Real favicon Generator
items.description: Just upload an image and this tool creates favicons for your website for all platforms.

items.name: The Front-End Checklist
items.description: Extremely popular checklist to check if your website's code is actually ready for deployment.

items.name: Web Usability Checklist
items.description: Another checklist, this one is to catch common usability problems of your website.

items.name: Website Speed Optimization Guide
items.description: An excellent guide to optimize your webpage speed. This is something many devs overlook!

items.name: Woorank
items.description: Get a SEO review of your website to address common issues, and get ahead of your competition.

items.name: Google Analytics
items.description: Get free insights about website traffic, visitors and conversions. A must for every website.

items.name: Fathom
items.description: A privacy-first alternative to Google Analytics. Doesn't require annoying GDPR cookie notices!

items.name: Netlify
items.description: My #1 go-to platform to host static websites. They have a very generous free plan!

items.name: Hover
items.description: If you need to buy a domain name, this is the place to go. I have all my domains here.

items.name: GitHub Pages
items.description: Free hosting for your static websites. I use it to host my open-source projects.

items.name: Vercel
items.description: Another great platform to host static websites. They have a very generous free plan!

items.name: Render
items.description: Another great platform to host static websites. They have a very generous free plan!

items.name: Cloudflare
items.description: A CDN that speeds up your website and protects it from attacks. I use it for all my websites.

resources.description: These are the best resources for Node.js development. They are all free or have a free version.

items.name: Jonas' Node.js Bootcamp
items.description: My premium course for modern back-end dev with Node, Express, MongoDB, and many more.

items.name: Node.js Documentation
items.description: The Node.js documentation is an essential guide for every developer. There are also useful guides.

items.name: Express Reference
items.description: Essential manual for building express applications. Also contains tutorials and other resources.

items.name: The MongoDB Manual
items.description: Learn all about the amazing features of MongoDB, especially the ones not covered in my course.

items.name: Mongoose Documentation
items.description: Keep this open at all times when building an app. Indispensable documentation for every developer!

items.name: Node.js Best Practices
items.description: Huge list of best practices for building Node apps. Important for big projects.

items.name: Awesome Node.js
items.description: Want to use more packages than you learned in my course? This is a great list to get you started!

items.name: Node Weekly Newsletter
items.description: This is how I stay informed about everything happening in the Node.js world.

items.name: Node.js Design Patterns
items.description: A great book to learn about design patterns in Node.js. I use it all the time.

items.name: Node.js Best Practices Book
items.description: A great book to learn about best practices in Node.js. I use it all the time.

items.name: Node.js Security Handbook
items.description: A great book to learn about security in Node.js. I use it all the time.
